name: contrasted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
contrast
C2 [ T ] to compare two people or things in order to show the differences between them: If you contrast some of her early writing with her later work, you can see just how much she improved.
C2 [ I ] If one thing contrasts with another, it is very different from it: The styles of the two film makers contrast quite dramatically. The tartness of the lemons contrasts with the sweetness of the honey.
More examplesFewer examplesHer later sensual works contrast starkly with the harsh earlier paintings.The president's passionate speech contrasted strongly with his subdued address to the parliament yesterday.What he said contrasted strikingly with what he actually did.The designer chose bright curtains and cushions that contrast with the subdued wallpaper.The sharpness of the lemon contrasts deliciously with the sweetness of the sugar.
